title: Compiler crash when calling a method of an impl with an associated type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
[playpen](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=eacea458468c575b6207&version=nightly)

``` rust
pub trait Tr {
    type A = ();
}

pub struct S<T, U> {
    data: T,
    more_data: U,
}

impl<T: Tr + Copy> S<T, <T as Tr>::A> {
    pub fn it_exists(&self) {
    }
}

#[test]
fn test() {
    let x = S {
        data: (),
        more_data: (),
    };
    x.it_exists();
}
```

> <anon>:23:7: 23:18 error: no method named `it_exists` found for type `S<(), ()>` in the current scope
> <anon>:23     x.it_exists();
>                 ^~~~~~~~~~~
> error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
> note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

